job description:
Objectives:
  • Set up processes to ensure data excellence within our proprietary and third-party databases, and regularly audit and refine datasets
  • Expand and improve the research platform, program, and output that demonstrates the firm's market expertise through data excellence and high data integrity
  • Understand and manage key resources, data vendors, and available technology
  • Refine and continuously improve data-oriented processes, from collection, to enhancement, to output functions that will drive JLL's research platform
  • Educate and collaborate with coworkers on using data and analytic techniques
  • Leverage and contribute to best practices and guidelines
  • Provide cross-functional support across property types (office, industrial, retail, multifamily and net lease) within the investor research team
  • Be part of the capital markets research plan that aligns with Americas research plans and overall business objectives
  • Collaborate at a high level with senior business leadership to execute the research plan
Specific Responsibilities:
  • Execute the statistical and analytical analysis of relevant property types and markets
  • Track, analyze and enhance proprietary and third-party datasets
  • Track and analyze supply and demand fundamentals, leasing comparables, sales and financing activity, and investor characteristics
  • Articulate in a compelling way market trends and insights internally and externally in written reports and presentations
  • Produce national capital markets research analyses and coordinate activities with local capital markets and research experts
  • Develop and share best data and research practice standards across the Americas Research Group
  • Develop strong relationships with internal and external clients and facilitate the use of research as a differentiator
  • Contribute to public relations initiatives to help build recognition for JLL's capital markets platform
  • Proactively leverage local market teams to enhance knowledge and gather critical information
  • Collaborate with capital markets research specialty team to provide on-going support across property types and regions
EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS
  • Up to one year in commercial real estate research or closely related field
  • Strong organizational, data collection, validation and auditing skills
  • Strong analytical skills and problem solving ability
  • Advanced command of Microsoft Office products (particularly Excel and PowerPoint) and database systems
  • Ability to efficiently multi-task, prioritize and manage work in a dynamic environment
  • Presentation skills and ability to work effectively with internal and external clients at all levels
  • Ability to effectively and professionally meet client expectations and positively represent the firm
  • Bachelors degree in business, economics or related field required
  • Motivated and self-starting with a desire to succeed and contribute to the success of a team
  • A desire to work within a diverse, collaborative and driven professional environment
